node.title: Not Your Traditional Hanukkah/Christmas Picture Book
node.description: When a stone thrower extinguishes a menorah’s lights in Lee Wind’s “Red and Green and Blue and White,” a community bands together.

node.title: Jewish Pride, and Prejudice, in Veera Hiranandani’s New Middle Grade Novel
node.description: “How to Find What You’re Not Looking For” views the elopement of a Jewish girl with a Hindu boy through the lens of Loving v. Virginia.

node.title: Republicans Blame Biden for Pandemic’s Persistence
node.description: Republicans have fought mask requirements and vaccine mandates for months, but as coronavirus infections again rise, they are blaming the president for failing to end the health crisis.

node.title: The coalition agreement goes into detail. It’s a German tradition.
node.description: Sometimes long, sometimes laborious, coalition agreements have helped ensure the durability of German governments — mostly.

node.title: Iran Rebuffs U.N. Watchdog on Resuming Nuclear Inspections
node.description: The head of the U.N. nuclear agency said Tehran continues to refuse to let it replace key monitoring equipment that tracks the country’s nuclear program.

node.title: He Convinced Voters He Would Be Like Merkel. But Who Is Olaf Scholz?
node.description: Germany’s next chancellor is something of an enigma. He comes to power with a dizzying array of challenges, raising questions about whether he can fill the very big shoes of his predecessor.

node.title: Almost half of humanity is eating too much or too little, report says
node.description: The Global Nutrition Report and other recent research shows a major gulf in diets around the world, with a big impact not only on our health, but the health of our planet.

node.title: Waukesha parade crash victim remembered as "a beautiful person"
node.description: John Kulich said his last day with his wife began at church listening to a sermon about great couples.

node.title: ‘8-Bit Christmas’ Review: Now You’re Playing With Power
node.description: Nintendo looms large in this sentimental, 1980s-set holiday comedy.

node.title: ‘A Boy Called Christmas’ Review: Kindling the Holiday Spirit
node.description: Enchanting imagery elevates this Netflix holiday adventure about a boy who journeys to a magic elfin city.

node.title: Maya Lin’s Dismantled ‘Ghost Forest’ to Be Reborn as Boats
node.description: Teenagers are making boats using the wood from her grove installation at Madison Square Park, and the artist is happy that the work is seeing a new life.

node.title: He’s the Brusque Mr. Fix-It for Mexico City’s Accordions
node.description: For 50 years, Francisco Luis Ramírez has been the go-to guy for instrument repairs in a nation that reveres the accordion. Now it’s a family business.

node.title: China Accused of 'Harassment' in South China Sea After Vowing to Back Down
node.description: Chinese government vessels continued to follow and photograph Philippine boats resupplying troops on a disputed South China Sea atoll on Tuesday, Manila said.

node.title: Ben Crump Says Defense Attorney Suggested Arbery Was A 'Runaway Slave' in Toenail Comment
node.description: "It's Trayvon Martin 2.0," Crump said, describing the defense's efforts to characterize Arbery as a "scary, Black man" in their closing arguments.

node.title: Online Tool Calculates Risk of COVID Exposure at Thanksgiving Gatherings
node.description: The tool comes as vaccinated Americans have been given the OK by health experts to gather for the holiday season.

node.title: Her Art Reads the Land in Deep Time
node.description: Athena LaTocha has embraced geological materials from mesas, wetlands and bluffs in her large-scale works. Now, she’s exploring what’s underfoot in New York City.

node.title: Why Some Dads Don’t Take Leave: They Think They’ll Be Punished
node.description: Until everyone has it, paid parental leave will be seen as nonessential.

node.title: Scientists Peer Hundreds of Feet Beneath the Surface of Mars, Find Ancient Lava
node.description: Using incredibly sensitive instruments, the researchers were able to map more than 600 feet beneath the surface of the Red Planet, finding dried lava.

node.title: Woman welcomes first baby at 50
node.description: "As I was starting the c-section, Susie was humming a gospel song that I am very familiar with. I knew we were both in good hands," her doctor sad.

node.title: Russian docking module launched to space station
node.description: The module will use a Russian "space tug" to rendezvous with the space station Friday.

node.title: House Hunting in Brazil: A 19th-Century House on the Coast
node.description: Following a severe recession in 2015 and 2016, Brazil’s housing market began a period of slow recovery, which accelerated during the pandemic.

node.title: It's Been 5 Months Since Kamala Harris Visited the Border—What Has She Said Since?
node.description: The vice president has faced criticism for her role in responding to the border crisis. But with the number of migrant crossings on the decline, her mission to address root causes could finally be paying off.

node.title: Some GOP states carve out "natural immunity" COVID vaccine exceptions
node.description: But currently authorized tests cannot measure how much protection you actually have from a prior infection.

node.title: A slate of foreign policy crises awaits the new chancellor.
node.description: Olaf Scholz will be confronted with an extraordinary array of troubles on the international stage that will test his mettle quickly.

node.title: COVID leaves Cyprus stockpiling millions of kilograms of halloumi
node.description: For many it's a staple of a BBQ but in Cyprus right now they have halloumi stockpiled in the millions of kilograms as the pandemic impacts exports badly.

node.title: Ethiopia's PM heads to front lines to personally direct fight against Tigray forces
node.description: The government says Abiy Ahmed has gone to take charge in a yearlong war,  leaving daily work of running the country to his deputy, as rival fighters approach the capital Addis Ababa.

node.title: Biden selects two women to lead Office of Management and Budget
node.description: The president will nominate Shalanda Young as the agency's chief. She'd be first Black woman in the post. And he'll name Nani Coloretti, who is Asian American, as deputy.

node.title: Scientists work to decode Moderna's COVID vaccine to help Africa
node.description: Only 5% of Africans are fully vaccinated against the coronavirus, thanks largely to big pharmaceutical companies supplying wealthy nations first. Rebels in lab coats are trying to redress the imbalance.

node.title: What should U.S. immigration policy be?
node.description: A CBS News poll takes a closer look at what's behind immigration views.

node.title: Jobless claims plunge to their lowest level in 52 years
node.description: Fewer than 200,000 Americans filed for unemployment benefits last week, the lowest figure since the pandemic struck.
